profile.profileDescription: CollectiveAccess Providence installation profile for UCLA Film and Television Archive. Based on PBCore 2.1.

label.description: Analog Moving Image component
Digital Moving Image component
Complete content in one part or intended to be completed in a finite number of parts.
Bars added at the sides
Bars added at the top and bottom.
Bars added at the side and the top and bottom.
Feet
Inches

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the set.

label.name: Item description
label.description: Narrative description for item in this set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the item in the context of this set.

label.name: Presentation type
label.description: Determines how set is rendered when displayed to the public in the Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Chronology element code
label.description: Element code of date range element to be used when placing set items into chronological order.

label.name: Authorization date
label.description: The date when the loan was authorized.

label.name: Loan in date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan out date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan return date
label.description: The date a loan is due back to the lending institution.

label.name: Loan renewal application date
label.description: The date to apply for a renewal to the loan.

label.name: Loan conditions
label.description: A statement of the conditions on a loan.

label.name: Loan note
label.description: General information about the loan.

label.name: Loan purpose
label.description: General information about the purpose of loan.

label.name: Movement method
label.description: The method used in the movement of an object.

label.name: Movement note
label.description: Additional information about the movement of an object or group of objects.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object is to be removed from its current location.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object was actually removed from its current location.

label.name: Reason for move
label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the tour.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Library of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a dropdown with search results (ordered by score). Selected geoname is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: Description
label.description: Narrative description. This is the primary text used to document the item.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: Description
label.description: Narrative biography for entity. This is the primary text used to document the entity.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of entity biography. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Institution
label.description: Name of the institution to which the collection belongs.

label.name: Extension
label.description: pbcoreExtension is an extension element. Use this element as a wrapper containing a specific element from another standard.

label.name: Coverage
label.description: coverage refers to either the geographic location or the time period covered by the asset’s intellectual content. For geographic locations (‘spatial’ descriptors), it is expressed by keywords such as place names (e.g. ‘Alaska’ or ‘Washington, DC’), numeric coordinates or geo-spatial data. For time-based events (‘temporal’ descriptors), it is expressed by using a date, period, era, or time-based event that is portrayed or covered in the intellectual content (e.g. ‘2007’ or ‘Victorian Era’). The PBCore metadata element coverage houses the actual spatial or temporal keywords. The companion element coverageType is used to identify the type of keywords that are being used.

label.name: Additional PBCore Identifiers
label.description: pbcoreIdentifier is an identifier that can apply to the asset. This identifier should not be limited to a specific instantiation, but rather all instantiations of an asset. It can also hold a URL or URI that points to the asset.

label.name: Additional Instantiation Identifiers
label.description: instantiationIdentifier contains an unambiguous reference or identifier for a particular instantiation of an asset.

label.name: Additional Titles
label.description: pbcoreTitle is a name or label relevant to the asset. There may be many types of titles an asset may have, such as a series title, episode title, segment title, or project title, therefore the element is repeatable.

label.name: Description
label.description: pbcoreDescription is an element that uses free-form text or a narrative to report general notes, abstracts, or summaries about the intellectual content of an asset. The information may be in the form of an individual program description, anecdotal interpretations, or brief content reviews. The description may also consist of outlines, lists, bullet points, rundowns, edit decision lists, indexes, or tables of content.

label.name: Asset Type
label.description: A broad definition of the type or description level of the intellectual content being described.

label.name: Form/Genre
label.description: Describes the Form or Genre. Form describes the format and/or purpose of a Work, e.g., “non-fiction”, “short” and “animation”. Genre describes categories of Works, characterized by similar plots, themes, settings, situations, and characters. Examples of genres are “westerns” and “thrillers”.

label.name: Audience Level
label.description: Identifies a type of audience, viewer, or listener for whom the media item is primarily designed or educationally useful.

label.name: Audience Rating
label.description: Designates the type of users for whom the intellectual content of a media item is intended or judged appropriate. This element differs from the element pbcoreAudienceLevel in that it utilizes standard ratings that have been crafted by the broadcast television and film industries and that are used as flags for audience or age-appropriate materials.

label.name: Relation
label.description: The descriptor relationType identifies the type of work bond between a media item you are cataloging and some other related media item.

label.name: Rights Summary
label.description: rightsSummary is used as a general free-text element to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over an asset or instantiation, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified as needed

label.name: Rights Link
label.description: rightsLink is a URI pointing to a declaration of rights.

label.name: Instantiation Rights Summary
label.description: rightsSummary is used as a general free-text element to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over an asset or instantiation, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified as needed

label.name: Instantiation Rights Link
label.description: rightsLink is a URI pointing to a declaration of rights.

label.name: Digital file format
label.description: File format for digital moving images.

label.name: Instantiation Time Start
label.description: instantiationTimeStart describes the point at which playback begins for a time-based instantiation. It is likely that the content on a tape may begin an arbitrary amount of time after the beginning of the instantiation.

label.name: Instantiation Duration
label.description: The element instantiationDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a time-based media item. It represents the playback time. Best practice is to use a timestamp format such as HH:MM:SS[:|;]FF or HH:MM:SS.mmm or S.mmm.

label.name: Instantiation Data Rate
label.description: The amount of data in a digital media file that is encoded, delivered or distributed, for every second of time.

label.name: Instantiation Tracks
label.description: The element instantiationTracks is simply intended to indicate the number and type of tracks that are found in a media item, whether it is analog or digital. (e.g. 1 video track, 2 audio tracks, 1 text track, 1 sprite track, etc.) Other configuration information specific to these identified tracks should be described using instantiationChannelConfiguration.

label.name: Instantiation Language
label.description: instantiationLanguage identifies the primary language of the tracks’ audio or text. Languages must be indicated using 3-letter codes standardized in ISO 639-2 or 639-3. If an instantiation includes more than one language, the element can be repeated. Alternately, both languages can be expressed in one element by separating two three-letter codes with a semicolon, i.e. eng;fre.

label.name: Essence Track
label.description: instantiationEssenceTrack is an XML container element that allows for grouping of related essenceTrack elements and their repeated use. Use instantiationEssenceTrack element to describe the individual streams that comprise an instantiation, such as audio, video, timecode, etc.

label.name: Track Type
label.description: essenceTrackType refers to the media type of the decoded data. Tracks may possibly be of these types: video, audio, caption, metadata, image, etc.

label.name: Track Type
label.description: essenceTrackType refers to the media type of the decoded data. Tracks may possibly be of these types: video, audio, caption, metadata, image, etc.

label.name: Track Identifier
label.description: essenceTrackIdentifier is an identifier of the track. Several audiovisual containers include such identifier schema to identify each track, such as MPEG2 PIDs or QuickTime Track ids

label.name: Track Identifier
label.description: essenceTrackIdentifier is an identifier of the track. Several audiovisual containers include such identifier schema to identify each track, such as MPEG2 PIDs or QuickTime Track ids

label.name: Track Identifier Source
label.description: the name of the software or tool that provided the Track Identifier

label.name: Track Identifier Source
label.description: the name of the software or tool that provided the Track Identifier

label.name: Track Standard
label.description: essenceTrackStandard should be be used with file-based instantiations to describe the broadcast standard of the video signal (e.g. NTSC, PAL) or to further clarify the standard of the essenceTrackEncoding format.

label.name: Track Standard
label.description: essenceTrackStandard should be be used with file-based instantiations to describe the broadcast standard of the video signal (e.g. NTSC, PAL) or to further clarify the standard of the essenceTrackEncoding format.

label.name: Track Encoding
label.description: essenceTrackEncoding identifies how the actual information in an instantiation is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme. Identifying the encoding used is beneficial for a number of reasons, including as a way to achieve reversible compression; for the construction of document indices to facilitate searching and access; or for efficient distribution of the information across data networks with differing bandwidths or pipeline capacities. Human-readable encoding value should be placed here.

label.name: Track Encoding
label.description: essenceTrackEncoding identifies how the actual information in an instantiation is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme. Identifying the encoding used is beneficial for a number of reasons, including as a way to achieve reversible compression; for the construction of document indices to facilitate searching and access; or for efficient distribution of the information across data networks with differing bandwidths or pipeline capacities. Human-readable encoding value should be placed here.

label.name: Track Data Rate
label.description: essenceTrackDataRate measures the amount of data used per time interval for encoded data. The data rate can be calculated by dividing the total data size of the track's encoded data by a time unit.

label.name: Track Data Rate
label.description: essenceTrackDataRate measures the amount of data used per time interval for encoded data. The data rate can be calculated by dividing the total data size of the track's encoded data by a time unit.

label.name: Track Time Start
label.description: essenceTrackTimeStart provides a time stamp for the beginning point of playback for a time-based essence track. It is likely that the content on a tape may begin an arbitrary amount of time after the beginning of the instantiation.

label.name: Track Time Start
label.description: essenceTrackTimeStart provides a time stamp for the beginning point of playback for a time-based essence track. It is likely that the content on a tape may begin an arbitrary amount of time after the beginning of the instantiation.

label.name: Track Duration
label.description: essenceTrackDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a track. It represents the track playback time

label.name: Track Duration
label.description: essenceTrackDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a track. It represents the track playback time

label.name: Track Bit Depth
label.description: essenceTrackBitDepth specifies how much data is sampled when information is digitized, encoded, or converted for an instantiation (specifically, audio, video, or image). Bit depth is measured in bits and generally implies an arbitrary perception of quality during playback of an instantiation (the higher the bit depth, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Bit Depth
label.description: essenceTrackBitDepth specifies how much data is sampled when information is digitized, encoded, or converted for an instantiation (specifically, audio, video, or image). Bit depth is measured in bits and generally implies an arbitrary perception of quality during playback of an instantiation (the higher the bit depth, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Sampling Rate
label.description: essenceTrackSamplingRate measures how often data is sampled when information from the audio portion from an instantiation is digitized. For a digital audio signal, the sampling rate is measured in kilohertz and is an indicator of the perceived playback quality of the media item (the higher the sampling rate, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Sampling Rate
label.description: essenceTrackSamplingRate measures how often data is sampled when information from the audio portion from an instantiation is digitized. For a digital audio signal, the sampling rate is measured in kilohertz and is an indicator of the perceived playback quality of the media item (the higher the sampling rate, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Playback Speed
label.description: essenceTrackPlaybackSpeed specifies the rate of units against time at which the media track should be rendered for human consumption. e.g., 15ips (inches per second).

label.name: Track Playback Speed
label.description: essenceTrackPlaybackSpeed specifies the rate of units against time at which the media track should be rendered for human consumption. e.g., 15ips (inches per second).

label.name: Track Frame Size
label.description: essenceTrackFrameSize measures the width and height of the encoded video or image track. The frame size refers to the size of the encoded pixels and not the size of the displayed image. It may be expressed as combination of pixels measured horizontally vs. the number of pixels of image/resolution data stacked vertically (interlaced and progressive scan).

label.name: Track Frame Size
label.description: essenceTrackFrameSize measures the width and height of the encoded video or image track. The frame size refers to the size of the encoded pixels and not the size of the displayed image. It may be expressed as combination of pixels measured horizontally vs. the number of pixels of image/resolution data stacked vertically (interlaced and progressive scan).

label.name: Track Aspect Ratio
label.description: essenceTrackAspectRatio indicates the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static image or moving image.

label.name: Track Aspect Ratio
label.description: essenceTrackAspectRatio indicates the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static image or moving image.

label.name: Track Frame Rate
label.description: essenceTrackFrameRate is relevant to tracks of video track type only. The frame rate is calculated by dividing the total number of frames by the duration of the video track. By default measure frame rate in frames per second expressed as fps as a unit of measure. e.g., 24 fps.

label.name: Track Frame Rate
label.description: essenceTrackFrameRate is relevant to tracks of video track type only. The frame rate is calculated by dividing the total number of frames by the duration of the video track. By default measure frame rate in frames per second expressed as fps as a unit of measure. e.g., 24 fps.

label.name: Track Language
label.description: essenceTrackLanguage identifies the primary language of the tracks’ audio or text. Languages must be indicated using 3-letter codes standardized in ISO 639-2 or 639-3. If an instantiation includes more than one language, the element can be repeated. Alternately, both languages can be expressed in one element by separating two three-letter codes with a semicolon, i.e. eng;fre.

label.name: Track Language
label.description: essenceTrackLanguage identifies the primary language of the tracks’ audio or text. Languages must be indicated using 3-letter codes standardized in ISO 639-2 or 639-3. If an instantiation includes more than one language, the element can be repeated. Alternately, both languages can be expressed in one element by separating two three-letter codes with a semicolon, i.e. eng;fre.

label.name: Track Annotation
label.description: essenceTrackAnnotation can store any supplementary information about a track or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Track Annotation
label.description: essenceTrackAnnotation can store any supplementary information about a track or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Subject
label.description: pbcoreSubject is used to assign topic headings or keywords that portray the intellectual content of the asset. A subject is expressed by keywords, key phrases, or even specific classification codes. Controlled vocabularies, authorities, formal classification codes, as well as folksonomies and user-generated tags, may be employed when assigning descriptive subject terms.

label.name: Annotation
label.description: pbcoreAnnotation allows the addition of any supplementary information about the metadata used to describe the PBCore record. pbcoreAnnotation clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Instantiation Annotation
label.description: instantiationAnnotation is used to add any supplementary information about an instantiation of the instantiation or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Instantiation Standard
label.description: If the instantiation is a physical item, instantiationStandard can be used to refer to the broadcast standard of the video signal (e.g. NTSC, PAL), or the audio encoding (e.g. Dolby A, vertical cut). If the instantiation is a digital item, instantiationStandard should be used to express the container format of the digital file (e.g. MXF).

label.name: Instantiation Alternative Modes
label.description: instantiationAlternativeModes is a catch-all metadata element that identifies equivalent alternatives to the primary visual, sound or textual information that exists in an instantiation. These are modes that offer alternative ways to see, hear, and read the content of an instantiation. Examples include DVI (Descriptive Video Information), SAP (Supplementary Audio Program), ClosedCaptions, OpenCaptions, Subtitles, Language Dubs, and Transcripts. For each instance of available alternativeModes, the mode and its associated language should be identified together, if applicable. Examples include ‘SAP in English,’ ‘SAP in Spanish,’ ‘Subtitle in French,’ ‘OpenCaption in Arabic.’

label.name: Instantiation Dimensions
label.description:
Specifies either the dimensions of a physical instantiation, or high-level visual dimensions.
Best Practice: For physical dimensions, usage examples might be 7″ for an audio reel. When describing visual dimensions, use this for high-level descriptors such as 1080p.

label.name: Storage Format
label.description: For Analog: 1000 ft can, etc. For Digital: Hard Drive, LTO, etc.

label.name: Frame rate
label.description: The native frames per second rate. Information related to the frame rate used during a digitization process is added to Transfer Speed.

label.name: Resolution
label.description: E.g., Standard Definition, High Definition, 2k, 4k, 6k, 8k

label.name: Overall Condition
label.description: High-level description of the condition of the Object and its Components, where relevant.

label.name: Object purpose
label.description: Describes purpose or function of the Object, e.g., Archival copy, Research copy, Conservation copy, etc.

label.name: Specific Component Number
label.description: Denotes the actual component number.

label.name: Loan Status
label.description: Indicates the status of the loan, e.g., "Requested", "Approved", "Returned"

label.name: General carrier type
label.description: The broad media type of the Object. Recording this high-level information will enable simple searching for only film, video, digital, etc. elements rather than searching by all possible formats and carriers.

label.name: Base
label.description: The physical material or video format, e.g., describing the flexible transparent material that supports a film object’s emulsion or a magnetic track, (e.g., acetate, nitrate, CTA, etc.).

label.name: Stock type
label.description: Describes the specific stock/brand on which the Item is captured, for example, Eastman Kodak, Fuji, 3M, etc. This element should be used for all media: film, video, audio, optical, digital tape, external hard drives.

label.name: Stock batch
label.description: The stock batch number or edge code of the media the Item is captured on. This can be a video, audio, optical media, or digital tape stock. Identifying the batch number can assist in identifying problems related to specific manufactured batches

label.name: Aspect ratio
label.description: The projected image area visible on screen, expressed as a value of width to height (the value of height always being “1”), e.g., 2.34:1, 2.39:1.

label.name: Aperture
label.description: The actual exposed image or picture area as it appears on the moving image itself, e.g., Academy, Full screen, Widescreen, etc. The image format does not necessarily bear any relation to the projection ratio (aspect ratio) of the moving image.

label.name: Sound channel configuration
label.description: The element instantiationChannelConfiguration is designed to indicate, at a general narrative level, the arrangement or configuration of specific channels or layers of information within an instantiation’s tracks. Examples are 2-track mono, 8- track stereo, or video track with alpha channel.

label.name: Sound type
label.description: Indicate the presence or absence of sound, e.g.,. “sound,” “silent,” “mute”.

label.name: Sound system
label.description: Describes the technical or proprietary system used to record the sound, e.g., Dolby SR, Dolby Digital, etc.

label.name: Sound fixation type
label.description: The name of the physical principle of sound recording, e.g., “Needle,”, “Optical,” “Magnetic,” etc.

label.name: Color type
label.description: Indicates the overall color, grayscale, or black and white nature of the presentation of an instantiation, as a single occurrence or combination of occurrences in or throughout the instantiation.

label.name: Color standard
label.description: The system or process by which color is fixed on the carrier or as part of the digital encoding, e.g., Pathécolor, Technicolor, etc.

settings.setting:
Specifies either the dimensions of a physical instantiation, or high-level visual dimensions.
Best Practice: For physical dimensions, usage examples might be 7″ for an audio reel. When describing visual dimensions, use this for high-level descriptors such as 1080p.

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Cataloguers
role.description: Confers actions needed by those editing catalogue entries

role.name: Researcher
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: User content moderator
role.description: Allows users to moderate user generated tags and comments

group.name: Cataloguers
group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries
